newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran says 70,000 Iraqi refugees returned home.
newsitem.headline: Iran says 70,000 Iraqi refugees returned home.

text.p: Some 70,000 Iraqi Kurdish refugees have left cold mountain camps in Iran to return to northern Iraq, Iran's Interior Minister Ali Mohammad Besharati said on Monday.
He told the Iranian news agency IRNA about 5,000 refugees remained in the Islamic republic.
The refugees fled fighting between rival Kurdish factions in northern Iraq that erupted in late August. A U.S.-brokered truce has been holding.
Ahmad Hosseini, Iran's top refugee official, said Iran had spent 45 billion rials ($15 million) housing refugees in six camps, IRNA added.
